He turned the tide of this glorious battle by also using the VINDISALTSHAKER and shaking the salt back into Anthony's ♥♥♥. Double Action: Boogaloo is a lighthearted shooter sure to bring about some laughs with your mates. Choose 1 of several perks, choose your weapons, then fly through the air in combat.  Attack: Left click is shoot, Middle Wheel click is melee, f is grenade if you have it equipped Stunts: Right click makes you tackle-dive, ctrl then right click makes you slide-tackle. In most cases it is good to always be using your stunts Shift: more accurate aim, very useful with the Vindicator rifle on the rooftop map C: activate slow motion if you have time built up B: Switch your weapons or ablility at any time  My Strategy: Brawler with Vindicator + H.E. Grenade or Brawler with Vindicator + Undertaker Vindicator is a powerful rifle decent for short/mid range, but great at long distance. Use Shift to snipe a few players before propelling your body head first to the lower rooftop, guns blazing. Grenade is good for multikills, and areas where players mosh together, not much else to say about that. Undertaker is a fast sub machine gun for close quarters. It works will with the Vindicator in that once you empty the vindicator's clip, you can quickly switch to the Undertaker to get a quick life-saving kill before reloading your primary. MELEE MELEE MELEE MELEE MELEE MELEE MELEE MELEE MELEE MELEE MELEE MELEE MELEE MELEE MELEE MELEE Did I mention that you should melee as a brawler? Your melee strength is higher as a brawler, and kills, especially melee kills, build up a brawler bar. Once it is in the 80s or higher range, you can switch to your fists by pressing 1 and then left click. Your fists should be glowing. Now run around spamming left and right click, you will rack up tons of multikills on close-quarter parts of maps, like on Rooftop. Today is my first day playing this game, but I have to say it's a good game utilizing the Source Engine pretty will. It's a nice break from more serious shooters, and will surely be one to play with your pals.

Did you enjoy A Better Tommorow? Hard Boiled? or any other John Woo action movie? If so Double Action Boogaloo (DAB) is the game for you..  Bullter time,diving,flipping of walls this game is packed with action movie cliches...  You aren’t scored on number of kills – rather, you’re scored on style, so you can sit perfectly still and plug away at people all day with an assault rifle and come in last, while the guy leaping off balconies and shooting people in mid-air with his twin pistols is going to clean up.  Look – play it, if you can. DAB is doing something different and charming and inherently tongue-in-cheek, and I really appreciate the creator for not only taking the time to let me dive through plate-glass windows and shoot people in the face, but to encourage me to do so.

Double Action Boogaloo is a great third person shooter, where players leap and slide around in order to dodge enemy fire. Points are scored based on stunt points, earned by scoring kills mid leap, mid slide, dodging grenades, headshots and more. There are a number of weapons to choose from, but few playable characters to choose from.  This game features a slow-motion gimmick, where you earn seconds on a slow-mo clock that, when activated, slows time around you (moreso for your opponents) to make aiming easy. There are several maps and you will quickly find areas on these maps that you will want to control in order to dish out the most damage. Protip: da_cocaine's garage entrance ramp.  This game is exclusively multiplayer, but does support bots. I would recommend it to everyone because its fun, and not because I need more people to play this game so I have more opponents to make ragequit.

This game.....  Shortening this review in words that some will find quite adrenaline-pumping:  Imagine diving out of a building in slow-motion, shooting a guy from where you just jumped, and when you land on the next building, you notice an enemy. You two throw eachother around and try to kill eachother in a bloody, mad and awesome fight. Until he suddenly unholsters his shotty. 'I am dead' you mutter to yourself as you blindly throw a grenade to his location. He tries to dive away from it, but it's too late....  Both of you are sent flying away from the rooftop of the building into the majestic fall to meet Mr.Concrete at street level. While you fall, you start to shoot your nemesis, and so he does until all you have left is your pistol, only carrying one bullet inside. You take your time to aim, 5 seconds until you hit the ground, and shoot the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥.  Turns out it was a headshot, the guy who was previously blazing his guns at you is now nothing but a blood-stained corpse free-falling, and you enter slow-motion in just enough time to sigh, re-think your whole life as the damned Mr.Concrete comes closer. You then drop your pistol and sends it flying to the side while you close your eyes and enter a free-falling pose, your body now being embraced by the concrete, all your bones having been broken and your miserable life extinguished from the face of the Earth.  That is 2 minutes of what this game can offer you.  100/10, bealtiful frekin' masterpiece.

At first, the movement is kind of something you need to get used to, because it can be very slippery and glidy. But once you get the hang of it, it is pretty fun! It is not bunny hopping, it is Squirrel Hopping! :D  The only thing I probably don't like about this game would have to be the lack of game-modes that is currently out there (as of 11.2.14), and that the player models looks very generic. What if Max Payne had multiplayer? Did you ever want to have a deathmatch game where you felt like a crazy action star a la Jason Stathem or Keanu Reaves?  Well, here you go DOUBLE ACTION BOOGALOO! Its less about getting the most kills and more about doing the most stylish action. Jump at a wall, dive away from it and blast your opponents with a machine gun to get style points.  Sometimes the game will start a race between checkpoints around the map. If you die you start over.  Great fun. Every one who likes shooting games should play this.

Dustforce truly is a work of art. I don't mean that lightly. The way it's animated plus its music gives it that title in my book. I can find myself playing one level for an hour, maybe even hours at a time. The frustration of losing levels is filled with relaxation and calmness because of the ambient music. The way the levels are crafted is truly mindblowing. They had a system in which you had to perfect a level to earn a key, and you would use that key to earn more levels. In layman's terms, to earn more levels, you had to perfect current levels. They ditched that and added an XP system in which you gain more XP to earn a key the more levels you play and perfect. I'm very glad they added this system and was skeptical about buying it. But now that I did buy it, I do not regret it even for a second. One thing I really love about this game is how you don't have to unlock base levels. In a sense, this game is open world. That sense is that many levels are available to you, and you can choose whether you want to advance into more challenging levels, or stay where you're at. To get an S in completion, you have to sweep up EVERY leaf, and to get an S in Finesse, you have to maintain your combo throughout an entire level.   Another thing I absolutely enjoy about Dustforce is its expasive community. There are lots of Community Workshop maps for you to sharpen your skills on, and lots of people who can set a good example. I'm sure most of the people who get best times on all the levels have a Youtube channel, so you can probably catch them there. The community may or not be active, but it sure is good and friendly.  Overall, in terms of gameplay, music, artstyle, animation, and difficulty (it's not an easy game, but it's not that hard of a game either. It just depends on how much you want to play it), I rate this game:  10/10 BUY THIS GAME.

Once I restarted I could spawn but once I did my eyes exploded because the game was missing it's own textures! This would be okay in games like Gmod because there is third party mods. But a standalone game. WHAT? After I got over the stupidity of the missing textures I joined a different server. I could spawn, and there wasn't missing textures. It lagged so bad it was already terrible. On top of all this there was people flying through the air sideways like a bunch of hackers. Here's the funny part though, THEY WEREN'T HACKING. Are you amazed at this game yet. Due to this 'reasonable gameplay' you couldn't hit anyone. There is one good part, there was slowmo! Of course you couldn't use it unless you killed someone while flying past them on your side leaving you an interval of 0.1 seconds to hit them. But then you get some seconds of slowmo! The problem is that it was an extremely small map and you constantly fall off the edge and die. But that's all in the fun right? Oh and the amazing 'killcam' which featured a really 'high quality' picture of you holding a 'gun' while 'someone' is 'shooting' at you! But don't listen to me go ahead and waste your time downloading it. It should be less than free, they should be paying me.

GET THIS GAME! The game is basically a 3rd/1st person shooter with Max Payne/The Matrix epic jumps running on none other than the faithful Source engine. You kill enemies for style points which help you get perks and slow-motion seconds. The game is pretty fair, and I didn't feel like there were any cheap kills.  The only real problem I have with it is that there is little indication on when you're getting shot. There are red marks on the screen, but I wasn't paying attention to them with all the craziness going on. The sound of enemies' guns, more often than not, only play when they are close to you, meaning that I would sometimes appear to die out of nowhere. All things considered, give it a go. After all, It's free.

I'm having qualms about the fact that good players get boosters to help them win as opposed to having powerups on the map like there was in Specialists, but hey, it's a spiritual successor to Specialists, that's more than enough reason to check it out. The gunplay is wonky, but the sliding and stunts feel and control excellent and intuitively. The game's crazy fast, and the bots are fun to practice against. It handles the switch from first/third person very elegantly and feels almost as if the game's fully designed to play either option, which is quite a feat.

This game is like Call of Duty on cocaine. The fast-paced action and silliness makes it a great game to play when bored and not in the mood to play a more serious game like CSGO. The classes and gun types also help make it more than just a game where you jump around and do flips while shooting people. The point system is interesting and perfect for this game. Rather than get points by getting kills, you get them by landing bullits on opponents in the most stylish way possible. This encouraged me to do crazier things in order to win. One time, I found myself jumping at a wall, bouncing off it, and then doing a flip mid air while shooting at someone behind the wall. That right there makes this game awesome. And the finishing touch... It's Free! 10/10 (Review by OrangespongeMan)

A short list of one-word game reviews Star Wars Battlefront 2015 - garbage Star Wars Battlefront 1 and 2 - amazing Unturned - great Space Engineers - worthless Double Action....         :D  Actual review: Double Action is a great free game (not free 2 play) where players fight against each other in a hilarious way of using stunts to gain points meaning, whoever gets the most kills will NOT always be the winner. I gauruntee you will be laughing from having a shotgun vs uzi duel where all of you are flipping around and jumping off buildings at the same time. The game is also 'anti sore loser 12 year old friendly'. Heres some examples. I walked around shooting when I saw a COD player doing flips in the air but not doing anything else. I pointed my shotgun at him and took em' out. He then started screaming into his mic but was targeted by my fellow players until he left. Another time a noob who did not know how to do stunts started running at me shooting while I stood facing a dead end. He then stood still to aim for my head when I jumped on the wall, flipping over him, and getting a one-shot head-shot kill. He then proceeded to call me a hacker and yell at me screeming like a baby. My fellow players then targeted him and called HIM a hacker every time he killed them until he left through fear that we would report him to someplace.  10/10 sore loser free

Before Counter-Strike won the Mod War (1996-2003), it was common for total conversions to take cues from John Woo films. Mods like Action Quake 2 (and its Action * derivatives), The Opera and The Specialists made multiplayer that wasn’t simply about running and shooting, but about doing both in style, preferably by diving sideways in slow motion through a skyscraper window while idly daydreaming about how good the Matrix sequels were surely going to be.  Those days may live again (even the Matrix bit, if you still dare to dream): some of the makers of the Specialists have released a free, standalone multiplayer shooter called Double Action: Boogaloo. Free as in free, that is; no microtransactions or free-to-play infrastructure, just a simple game of wielding pistols akimbo and releasing flocks of doves

Lets start off saying I was very excited someone wanted to remake/honor the specialists mod. TS was my favorite mod for such a long time and when the servers died out I was completely bummed out. TS failed after 2.1 when it was completely screwed up at 3.0.  While I have fun playing double action it really in no way holds a candle to TS. Such limited weapon selection the no kick to disarm enemies, and being light enough to do front flips while running is completely left out of this game as well. A person carrying a rifle isnt much slower/less manuverable than someone with just a pistol. Ammunition seems endless in TS when i would go on a run and be the specialist i would have to pick up random weapons just to find something with ammo all the time adding to skill being able to use em all. Point system based on hits while sliding and all that is not cool either. TS was a kill death ratio game and the stunts were used to escape or aid in doing so. I will still rate this positive just because it makes me smile thinking of TS. Steam should bring back the specialists 2.1 and then we would all be having fun.

Let me preface this with the following: Double Action: Boogaloo is worth all the blood, sweat, and tears that went into the 0 dollars earned for buying this terriffic game.   Double Action is a god damned anomaly, being free to play has not hindered this game's meaningfullness as a medium for entertainment and competitiveness. Double Action features some really balanced gameplay, your skill is your skill, nothing else is the determining factor for success. You will run, jump, slide, and grapple your way through a series of levels, designed by mere mortals, as if they were designed my gods.    Overall, I would give Double Action a 9/10, it's fun, it's competitive, and it's everything you want it to be.

Before I even review this free to play, I have to mention this game doesn't even have a  single transaction .  Double Action: Boogaloo is a valve source game and in the game, you can play in third person or first while shooting guns and doing stunts. In the end of a round, the player with the most points win. To get more points, you need to do stunts while killing your opponent, making it very fast paced and challenging. Double Action: Boogaloo also has many gamemodes for you to enjoy. This game is quite simple as that.    I recommend it because it is free to play, but I wouldn't if you had to pay for this game   7.5/10

A short list of one-word game reviews Star Wars Battlefront 2015 - garbage Star Wars Battlefront 1 and 2 - amazing Unturned - great Space Engineers - worthless Double Action....         :D  Actual review: Double Action is a great free game (not free 2 play) where players fight against each other in a hilarious way of using stunts to gain points meaning, whoever gets the most kills will NOT always be the winner. I gauruntee you will be laughing from having a shotgun vs uzi duel where all of you are flipping around and jumping off buildings at the same time. The game is also 'anti sore loser 12 year old friendly'. Heres some examples. I walked around shooting when I saw a COD player doing flips in the air but not doing anything else. I pointed my shotgun at him and took em' out. He then started screaming into his mic but was targeted by my fellow players until he left. Another time a noob who did not know how to do stunts started running at me shooting while I stood facing a dead end. He then stood still to aim for my head when I jumped on the wall, flipping over him, and getting a one-shot head-shot kill. He then proceeded to call me a hacker and yell at me screeming like a baby. My fellow players then targeted him and called HIM a hacker every time he killed them until he left through fear that we would report him to someplace.  10/10 sore loser free

Honestly, one of the best F2P games I've played. I've had a load of fun with this game. It is pretty old, and can get kinda annoying when running into one of the many bugs, or hackers, but overall, it's so much fun.  I will also note that there isn't a huge variety of weapons to chose from, and the classes aren't super amazing, but they do offer unique gameplay. The one gamemode that is available in this game is also a bit unclear.   Overall I give this game a pretty solid 7.5/10, since it does have it's bugs, and can be littered with hackers at times. Other than that, the gameplay itself is really fun, and unique to anything I've really ever played.

One of the best F2P shooters on the store. Sad thing is that nobody plays it, although I think if more people talked about how good it was, that would be a much different story all together. Unique mechanics make this game both competitively balanced and fun as hell. Movement options are optimal and fun to use, as abusing Matrix style wall flips to dive out of them to escape a deadly fall in the nick of time is honestly one of the most badass maneurvers in this game. Though there are no wallruns or other horizontal movement options other than your special dives and running, the utter feeling of power is there. The bullet time is also fun as hell and is rewarded for ballsy kills, which makes it honestly feel less cheap. I found myself getting killed with skilled players who dipped and dived through bullets like I was. Few of these times was I found in the midst of a bullet time beating. Overall, this game does needs to be installed
